Author: princess-kitty-belle
Text: For me it was cutting out foods and being unable to eat foods that I'd previously enjoyed. The first moment for me when I went "oh shit" was when I called a boiled egg and half an orange a meal.

Author: lovelylayout
Text: The only thing that I've found is an *actual* red flag is obsession. Keeping an accurate log of calories consumed is not necessarily an obsession. Being very anxious about not being able to log, logging accurately, or going off-plan are signs of obsession.   Another one that's harder to nail down is being moralistic about food, beyond the general layer of "junk bad, Food good" over society (such as feeling that you deserve to be punished for eating a certain food or in a certain way or in a certain situation).
